alert.note: Alert for Brown; Clay; Cloud; Marshall; Nemaha; Ottawa; Republic; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 31 at 10:12AM CST until January 02 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT CST SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph resulting in visibilities of a half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Kansas. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to midnight CST Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very cold wind chills Saturday and Saturday night could be dangerous for vulnerable populations and those that may become stranded in their vehicles.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Clay; Cloud; Marshall; Nemaha; Ottawa; Republic; Washington
